image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu gestures while addressing reporters from behind a lectern.

props.synopsis: Protesters are camped outside the house of the Israeli prime minister and he has taken the country back into war, but these are not the only major issues the country's longest-serving leader must deal with.

title.children: 'Israel is very close to civil war': Netanyahu's turbulent week

image.altText: ANTHONY ALBANESE AND PETER DUTTON

props.synopsis: The stark difference between how the second Trump administration is "flooding the zone" and what the Coalition is doing is that the Trump team knows exactly what they are doing.

title.children: Coalition 'flooding the zone' as Trump does, but without as much strategy

image.altText: Sheets of perscription medication.

props.synopsis: Nearly 500,000 Australians could be missing out on hundreds of dollars in savings at the pharmacy each year because of poor understanding and uptake of the country's "clunky" pharmaceutical safety net scheme.

title.children: Close to 500k Australians could have missed out on savings at the pharmacy

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek in front of a tree.

props.synopsis: The government will pledge an additional $250 million in next week's federal budget, as part of efforts to conserve an additional 30 million hectares of Australian bushland.

title.children: Bushland the size of New Zealand to be protected under budget boost

image.altText: Coles and Woolworths branding outside neighbouring supermarkets

props.synopsis: Australia's supermarket sector looks ripe for the picking to an outside operator, but the latest probe into Woolworths and Coles confirms their dominance of the industry isn't going anywhere.

title.children: A year-long probe into supermarkets has reinforced what we already knew

image.altText: Garry Davis in a police interview room

props.synopsis: For months, I've spent my Saturdays speaking with a convicted killer, writes Anne Connolly. He says he's innocent, others fear he's guilty of even more.

title.children: What I learnt from four months' conversations with a killer

image.altText: Lilie James, who was killed at St Andrew's Cathedral School in Sydney's CBD on October 25, 2023, smiling in an undated selfie

props.synopsis: The man who murdered Lilie James was meticulous, calculated and calm. This was not a momentary loss of control, he knew what he was doing, an inquest into her death was told this week.

title.children: Friends mistook it as love. But Lilie James's killer was controlling

image.altText: David Shoebridge wearing a navy suit jacket and white shirt.

props.synopsis: Australian industry would receive $4 billion to manufacture drones and missiles under a new Greens party policy, which would come from scrapping billions of dollars in US contracts.

title.children: Greens promise $4b for 'self-defence' missiles in first defence spending policy

image.altText: Woman in red smiles at camera.

props.synopsis: The Coalition has vowed to cut waste from the government bureaucracy after criticising Labor for growing the public sector.

title.children: Productivity boss warns cutting public service won't save much money

image.altText: A blurry screengrab captures Elon Musk and and U.S. Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth laughing

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says war plans should not be shared with his billionaire adviser Elon Musk because of his business interests.

title.children: Musk can't access China war plans, Trump says amid Pentagon visit

image.altText: Na-Yeon makes a peace sign with her right hand as she leans and poses for a photograph that's been printed onto a square block.

props.synopsis: As AI technology rapidly improves, some people in South Korea talk with computer-generated models of their dead loved ones to process grief and say goodbye.

title.children: 'My heart became lighter': AI gave this grieving mum a final farewell

image.altText: An illustration with clouds in-filled with the Australian, UK and US flags

props.synopsis: Can Australia still trust the United States as an ally? Does Donald Trump even know what AUKUS is? These are your questions about the AUKUS trilateral security deal.

title.children: As an election looms, Your Say suggests AUKUS concerns could be a factor

image.altText: A massive ball of flames and smoke rises from an electrical substation at night

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of people have been grappling with up-ended travel plans after Europe's busiest airport was closed after losing power due to a fire.

title.children: Heathrow flights to resume as police probe 'catastrophic' fire that cut power

image.altText: Leslie Bibb arrives at the Vanity Fair Oscars party

props.synopsis: A quick search reveals how common, casual and uncoupled from shame and insult the term now is.

title.children: The 'worst word in the world' is now used to describe a must-have hairstyle

image.altText: A man with sandy hair and beard in a fleece-lined grey coat and checked shirt leans against a window that shows his reflection.

props.synopsis: After battling alone with the stigma of family sexual abuse, Travis found a community thanks to a new form of group therapy.

title.children: Travis was a 'healthy, active teenager' when his life was 'stolen'

image.altText: Nasty welts on a young man's back.

props.synopsis: Residents in Queensland's fire ant suppression zone are pleading for help, saying nest numbers and attacks on humans and animals have exploded since ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred swamped the state's south east.

title.children: Fire ant attacks 'explode' after they formed rafts and spread during ex-TC Alfred

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Close up of shopping trolley in supermarket aisle

props.synopsis: The "gamification" of supermarket loyalty programs could be influencing customers without them realising, according to the ACCC inquiry.

title.children: Your supermarket points program may influence you more than you realise

image.altText: For sale sign on Queenslander-style house that needs renovating in a street in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Income and property price caps for the housing scheme are set to rise as part of next week's federal budget.

title.children: Labor to lift income and property price caps on 'Help to Buy' scheme

image.altText: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz in a suit

props.synopsis: Israel's Defence Minister Israel Katz says he has ordered troops to go deeper into the Gaza Strip, vowing they would hold land until Hamas release hostages still captive.

title.children: Israel orders troops to 'seize more territory' in Gaza

image.altText: Children play with toys at a preschool

props.synopsis: Has privatisation of Australia's social services lived up to its promise?

title.children: 'A vast national experiment': The history of privatising care services

image.altText: A woman bends over and prays with a religious candle in her hand

props.synopsis: In its latest health update, the Vatican said the pope's condition remained stable with "minor improvements in breathing and mobility".

title.children: Pope must 'relearn to speak' after oxygen therapy, Vatican says

image.altText: A baby marmoset sitting on a green towel.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained under freedom of information laws show how marmosets and macaques are bred and experimented on at a regional Victorian facility to improve medical outcomes for humans.

title.children: Call to end experiments on caged monkeys bred at Monash University facility

image.altText: Lachlan Kennedy, Jeremiah Azu, of Great Britain and Akani Simbine at the World Indoor Athletics Championships.

props.synopsis: Lachlan Kennedy reaches the podium after finishing second in the men's 60 metres final at the World Athletics Indoor Championships in China.

title.children: Aussie sprinter Kennedy wins historic silver at world indoor titles

image.altText: Colourful picture with a shadowy figure on a horse against rolling hills

props.synopsis: Sam Poo was executed in October 1865 for murdering Senior Constable John Ward, but academic Meg Foster has doubts about the evidence for this crime.

title.children: Did this Chinese bushranger really kill a policeman? Here's what we know

image.altText: A small boat heads towards a turbine in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Six companies have now confirmed they won't pursue the federal government's offshore wind project in WA despite millions of dollars already invested.

title.children: Three more companies pull out of WA offshore wind project

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair holds up a moth-eaten knitted blanket.

props.synopsis: Releasing 10,000 of microscopic wasps into a home may not sound like the most obvious way to tackle a moth infestation, but it is an effective one.

title.children: Got a moth infestation? Thousands of tiny wasps might be the answer

image.altText: Steele Sidebottom and Scott Pendlebury clap the Magpies fans at the MCG.

props.synopsis: Despite some nervous moments, Collingwood coach Criag McRae is pleased with how his side is tracking after edging the Western Bulldogs by six points in an MCG thriller.

title.children: McRae satisfied with 'new version' of Magpies after tight win over Bulldogs

image.altText: Payne Haas holds the ball as he is tackled by a Cowboys NRL opponent.

props.synopsis: The Broncos claim bragging rights over the Cowboys following their 26-16 win in the Queensland derby at Lang Park.

title.children: 'Good test of our character': Maguire's Broncos growing in confidence

image.altText: A view of a hotel from a road.

props.synopsis: A hotel in Sydney's inner west, that once served as the inspiration for the Slim Dusty song Duncan, has been listed for sale.

title.children: Hotel that inspired top-selling Australian song listed for sale

image.altText: A woman does a cartwheel on a football field.

props.synopsis: The Fremantle Dockers star has found a force in having ADHD, especially on the football field. Can having neurodivergent traits like hyper-focus give athletes a real advantage?

title.children: AFLW player Emma O'Driscoll on using ADHD to her benefit

image.altText: bike doing a wheelie

props.synopsis: A plan to convert a defunct motocross site into an e-motorbike track is a step closer thanks to a new Gold Coast council lease, but opponents say it will "reward" poor behaviour.

title.children: Push to get 'dangerous' e-motorbikes off road and onto own legal track

image.altText: Aboriginal flag flying surrounded by trees

props.synopsis: Taken during colonial times, the skull from a young Tasmanian Aboriginal man was shipped to Europe. After spending more than 170 years in a Scottish university collection, and before that some years in a private collection, the ancestral remains will return home.

title.children: Tasmanian Aboriginal skull to be returned after 170 years in Scottish collection

image.altText: A photo of a scorched sign on a building reading 'pulse'.

props.synopsis: Thirteen people including a former government minister have been arrested in North Macedonia on Friday over a nightclub blaze that killed 59 people including six minors.

title.children: Thirteen arrested over North Macedonia nightclub fire which killed 59

image.altText: Diana Reid, a young woman with long brown hair, wearing a grey patterned blazer and white T-shirt

props.synopsis: Diana Reid, author of bestseller Love and Virtue, subverts the traditional trauma plot in a new summer noir thriller, Signs of Damage.

title.children: Author says her White-Lotus-style novel subverts a literary trend
